intro: Oerstedianthus carlsonae, commonly known as the Carlsson's ericaceous plant, is a rare shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical features include leathery leaves and clusters of pink or white blooms that appear in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
